conclusion: A square conductor frame with a side length of l moves uniformly from the left side of the magnetic field through the magnetic field to the right side. The width of the magnetic field is d, and the speed of the frame is v. If l < d, determine the time during which there is an induced current in the frame.
The image shows a square conductor frame with a side length of l moving uniformly from left to right through a magnetic field. The width of the magnetic field is d, and the speed of the frame is v.

premise: The conductor frame has a side length of l and moves at a speed of v.
conclusion: The frame enters the magnetic field on the left side and exits on the right side, which has a width of d.

premise: The frame is square, so it will be fully within the magnetic field when it is at its widest point.
Since l < d, the frame will be partially inside and outside the magnetic field at the start and end of its travel.
conclusion: The induced current in the frame will occur while the frame is fully inside the magnetic field.

premise: The frame will be inside the magnetic field for a time t when the full length of the frame (l) equals the width of the magnetic field (d).
conclusion: The time during which the induced current is present is calculated as t = d/v.
